title: Requirement Document
content:
# 1. Document Control & Versioning
**Author**: Idea-to-Deploy Platform
**Date**: 2025-12-26
**Version**: 1.0.0 (Baseline)

# 2. Project Background & Objectives
This project, **Build an event management platform that allows organizers to create events, sell tickets, manage attendees, process payments, and allows users to discover events, purchase tickets, and receive notifications.**, is designed to deliver a high-quality solution in the **E-commerce** domain. The primary objective is to streamline operations and provide value through specialized features.

# 3. Stakeholder Identification
- **Project Sponsor**: Idea-to-Deploy Platform
- **Technical Lead**: AI Architect
- **End Users**: Users interacting with E-commerce services.

# 4. Assumptions & Constraints
- **Assumption**: Scalable cloud infrastructure is available for deployment.
- **Constraint**: Delivery within a 12-week timeframe as per standard PMP guidelines.

# 5. In-Scope / Out-of-Scope
- **In-Scope**: Implementation of User Registration, Login, Logout and core E-commerce logic.
- **Out-of-Scope**: Physical hardware procurement and third-party legacy data cleaning.

# 6. Functional Requirements
## REQ-001: User Registration
The system shall provide robust User Registration capabilities to support the core functionality of Build an event management platform that allows organizers to create events, sell tickets, manage attendees, process payments, and allows users to discover events, purchase tickets, and receive notifications..

## REQ-002: Login
The system shall provide robust Login capabilities to support the core functionality of Build an event management platform that allows organizers to create events, sell tickets, manage attendees, process payments, and allows users to discover events, purchase tickets, and receive notifications..

## REQ-003: Logout
The system shall provide robust Logout capabilities to support the core functionality of Build an event management platform that allows organizers to create events, sell tickets, manage attendees, process payments, and allows users to discover events, purchase tickets, and receive notifications..

## REQ-004: Forgot Password
The system shall provide robust Forgot Password capabilities to support the core functionality of Build an event management platform that allows organizers to create events, sell tickets, manage attendees, process payments, and allows users to discover events, purchase tickets, and receive notifications..

## REQ-005: Profile Management
The system shall provide robust Profile Management capabilities to support the core functionality of Build an event management platform that allows organizers to create events, sell tickets, manage attendees, process payments, and allows users to discover events, purchase tickets, and receive notifications..

## REQ-006: Product Listing
The system shall provide robust Product Listing capabilities to support the core functionality of Build an event management platform that allows organizers to create events, sell tickets, manage attendees, process payments, and allows users to discover events, purchase tickets, and receive notifications..

## REQ-007: Shopping Cart
The system shall provide robust Shopping Cart capabilities to support the core functionality of Build an event management platform that allows organizers to create events, sell tickets, manage attendees, process payments, and allows users to discover events, purchase tickets, and receive notifications..

## REQ-008: Checkout
The system shall provide robust Checkout capabilities to support the core functionality of Build an event management platform that allows organizers to create events, sell tickets, manage attendees, process payments, and allows users to discover events, purchase tickets, and receive notifications..

## REQ-009: Order Management
The system shall provide robust Order Management capabilities to support the core functionality of Build an event management platform that allows organizers to create events, sell tickets, manage attendees, process payments, and allows users to discover events, purchase tickets, and receive notifications..

## REQ-0010: Payment Integration
The system shall provide robust Payment Integration capabilities to support the core functionality of Build an event management platform that allows organizers to create events, sell tickets, manage attendees, process payments, and allows users to discover events, purchase tickets, and receive notifications..

# 7. Non-Functional Requirements
- **NFR-001 (Performance)**: The Build an event management platform that allows organizers to create events, sell tickets, manage attendees, process payments, and allows users to discover events, purchase tickets, and receive notifications. system must load within 2 seconds.
- **NFR-002 (Security)**: All data for E-commerce must be encrypted at rest and in transit.

# 8. User Roles & Permissions
- **Admin**: Full access to manage the Build an event management platform that allows organizers to create events, sell tickets, manage attendees, process payments, and allows users to discover events, purchase tickets, and receive notifications. platform.
- **Standard User**: Access to core E-commerce features.

# 9. Business Rules
Data integrity must be maintained across all **E-commerce** transactions.

# 10. Use Cases / User Stories
- **US-001**: As a user, I want to use User Registration so that I can achieve my task in Build an event management platform that allows organizers to create events, sell tickets, manage attendees, process payments, and allows users to discover events, purchase tickets, and receive notifications..

# 11. UI/UX & Screen References
The interface will follow modern design principles tailored for the **E-commerce** industry.

# 12. Data Requirements
Relational database storage optimized for **E-commerce** data entities.

# 13. Regulatory & Compliance Requirements
Compliance with industry standards relevant to **E-commerce** and GDPR.

# 14. Requirement Traceability Matrix (RTM)
Linking all functional requirements (REQ-001 to REQ-0010) to business objectives.

title: Project Planning Document
content:
# 1. Project Overview
Project **Build an event management platform that allows organizers to create events, sell tickets, manage attendees, process payments, and allows users to discover events, purchase tickets, and receive notifications.** is a Moderate complexity project in the **E-commerce** sector.

# 2. Project Governance Structure
Strict PMP-based governance with a Project Manager overseeing the implementation of Build an event management platform that allows organizers to create events, sell tickets, manage attendees, process payments, and allows users to discover events, purchase tickets, and receive notifications..

# 3. Project Organization & Roles
- **Project Manager**: Managing the 12-week schedule.
- **Developers**: Implementing User Registration, Login, Logout, Forgot Password, Profile Management, Product Listing, Shopping Cart, Checkout, Order Management, Payment Integration.

# 4. Project Methodology (Agile)
Agile Scrum methodology with 2-week sprints to iterate on **Build an event management platform that allows organizers to create events, sell tickets, manage attendees, process payments, and allows users to discover events, purchase tickets, and receive notifications.** features.

# 5. Work Breakdown Structure (WBS)
- **Phase 1**: Initial Analysis & E-commerce Domain Research
- **Phase 2**: Development of User Registration, Login, Logout, Forgot Password, Profile Management
- **Phase 3**: Integration of remaining features
- **Phase 4**: Final Testing & Deployment of Build an event management platform that allows organizers to create events, sell tickets, manage attendees, process payments, and allows users to discover events, purchase tickets, and receive notifications.

# 6. Deliverables & Milestones
- **MS-1**: Requirement Sign-off (Week 2)
- **MS-2**: E-commerce MVP Completion (Week 8)
- **MS-3**: Final Handover of **Build an event management platform that allows organizers to create events, sell tickets, manage attendees, process payments, and allows users to discover events, purchase tickets, and receive notifications.** (Week 12)

# 7. Resource Planning
Engineers specializing in **E-commerce** technology stack and cloud architects.

# 8. Communication Management Plan
Bi-weekly status meetings regarding **Build an event management platform that allows organizers to create events, sell tickets, manage attendees, process payments, and allows users to discover events, purchase tickets, and receive notifications.** progress.

# 9. Change Management Plan
Standard change request process for any scope adjustments in the **Build an event management platform that allows organizers to create events, sell tickets, manage attendees, process payments, and allows users to discover events, purchase tickets, and receive notifications.** roadmap.

# 10. Dependency Management
Depends on the completion of the core **E-commerce** engine.

# 11. Assumptions & Constraints
Assumes availability of E-commerce domain experts for validation.

title: Technical Architecture & Delivery Plan
content:
# 1. Architecture Overview
Technical architecture design for **Build an event management platform that allows organizers to create events, sell tickets, manage attendees, process payments, and allows users to discover events, purchase tickets, and receive notifications.**, optimized for the **E-commerce** domain.

# 2. System Context Diagram
Shows how Build an event management platform that allows organizers to create events, sell tickets, manage attendees, process payments, and allows users to discover events, purchase tickets, and receive notifications. interacts with users and external E-commerce APIs.

# 3. Logical Architecture
Breakdown of the system into frontend, backend, and E-commerce-specific services.

# 4. Physical Architecture
Hosted on scalable cloud infrastructure to support the Moderate nature of **Build an event management platform that allows organizers to create events, sell tickets, manage attendees, process payments, and allows users to discover events, purchase tickets, and receive notifications.**.

# 5. Technology Stack
Utilizing: Next.js, Node.js, PostgreSQL, Stripe Integration.

# 6. Application Architecture
Modular design pattern to separate User Registration, Login, Logout from core platform logic.

# 7. Database & Data Flow Design
Schema design for **Build an event management platform that allows organizers to create events, sell tickets, manage attendees, process payments, and allows users to discover events, purchase tickets, and receive notifications.** entities including users and E-commerce specific data.

# 8. API & Integration Strategy
Secure RESTful endpoints for Build an event management platform that allows organizers to create events, sell tickets, manage attendees, process payments, and allows users to discover events, purchase tickets, and receive notifications. communication.

# 9. Security Architecture
JWT-based authentication and role-based access for Build an event management platform that allows organizers to create events, sell tickets, manage attendees, process payments, and allows users to discover events, purchase tickets, and receive notifications. users.

# 10. Scalability & Performance Design
Load balancing to handle E-commerce traffic spikes.

# 11. Deployment Architecture
Automated CI/CD pipeline for rapid Build an event management platform that allows organizers to create events, sell tickets, manage attendees, process payments, and allows users to discover events, purchase tickets, and receive notifications. iterations.

# 12. Technical Risks & Mitigations
Risk: Integration delay with E-commerce third-party tools.
Mitigation: Early prototyping of external interfaces.
